channel.title: Broken Xbox 360 (Disk Drive Problems)
channel.description:
Question: Has your xbox ever had the "Unreadable Disk Error"?
Have you tried to fix it yourself?
What was wrong with it?
How did you fix it?
I'm currently fixing mine, see Microsoft charges 100 bucks and 2 weeks to fix your xbox, yet i can fix mine for 8 dollars and in 30 minutes. I just needed a new motor (motor moves your laser up and down)

item.title: Broken Xbox 360 (Disk Drive Problems)
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:21, topic:340667”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=437038.msg3227799#msg3227799 date=1275760760]

Also, Microsoft get kudos for making a console as good as their competitors on their second try. How many consoles have sony made??

Yes, because the Playstation was a massive failure
[/quote]

Did I say it was? I’m just saying that Microsoft have done a ruddy good job of making a console as good as their competitors with much less time for trial & error…[/quote]
i wouldnt say its as good…

Read full topic

Also, Microsoft get kudos for making a console as good as their competitors on their second try. How many consoles have sony made??

what? microsoft came to the market at a much later time than sony, and the ps2 has still sold more than anything else

the xbox360 is pretty evenly match compared to the PS3, which isn’t bad because this is microsofts second console, sony have made so many more.
[/quote]
havent they made the same amount since microsoft started making them?[/quote]
Probably yes, but what I’m saying is microsoft have more overall experience…

item.title: Broken Xbox 360 (Disk Drive Problems)
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:10, topic:340667”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=437038.msg3218930#msg3218930 date=1274997342]

The warranty was gone because my friend was an idiot.

I just took off the GPU, reballed it, didn’t help, reflowed the HANA chip and boom. Problem solved.

Is it hard to fix RROD, I haven’t looked into it, my friend wants me to fix his.
[/quote]
From what i’ve read you just need to replace some screws for the CPU heatsink (might have bean GPU?)[/quote]That fix works by flexing the motherboard and making cracked solder balls reconnect. However, this additional pressure on the motherboard will cause more solder to crack and has even recorded braking traces.

This solution is temporary and will not last.

[quote=“the elve age, post:9, topic:340667”][quote author=the bank link=topic=437038.msg3218209#msg3218209 date=1274909539]
The warranty was gone because my friend was an idiot.

I just took off the GPU, reballed it, didn’t help, reflowed the HANA chip and boom. Problem solved.
[/quote]

Is it hard to fix RROD, I haven’t looked into it, my friend wants me to fix his.[/quote]As long as no one has done anything stupid like the towel trick, penny trick, x-clamp fix, eraser mod etc, then it should be easily fixable. But you will need the proper equipment.

You will need:

  • A reworking station
  • A preheater for your board (if the station doesn’t have one).
  • 40x40mm and 20x20 mm nozzles
  • Some new thermal paste (preferably Artic Silver 5)

Also, you will need the following tools:

Torx 10, Torx 8, an xbox opening kit (optional, but helps a lot. you can just cut apart a dvd spindle lid), and a small flat head screw driver for removing the x-clamps.

The xbox uses lead free solder which liquidates at 217C and it is recommended to reach a temperature of 230C for atleast 25 seconds but no more than 90 seconds. Note that this temperature should be BETWEEN the chip and the motherboard, not above or below it.

Keep the board suspended 1-1.5 inches from the preheater, which should be outputting 400F

Read full topic

item.title: Broken Xbox 360 (Disk Drive Problems)
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:9, topic:340667”][quote author=the bank link=topic=437038.msg3218209#msg3218209 date=1274909539]
The warranty was gone because my friend was an idiot.

I just took off the GPU, reballed it, didn’t help, reflowed the HANA chip and boom. Problem solved.
[/quote]

Is it hard to fix RROD, I haven’t looked into it, my friend wants me to fix his.[/quote]
From what i’ve read you just need to replace some screws for the CPU heatsink (might have bean GPU?)

Read full topic

item.title: Broken Xbox 360 (Disk Drive Problems)
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Naw thats k, I bought an RROD from a friend for 20 bucks and just finished fixing it. Just some small problems with the H/ANA chip.

Read full topic

item.title: Broken Xbox 360 (Disk Drive Problems)
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:4, topic:340667”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=437038.msg3211507#msg3211507 date=1274297442]

However, you also void your warranty by opening it up to fix it.

I encountered an E74 error awhile back. Most idiots believe this is due to failure in the processing unit, however, my error was caused by a corrupt driver for that hardware. Just flashed my drive with firmware from a backup I made a month before and worked wonders.

As for this error, it doesn’t cost $100 if it is still under warranty, which mine was not (adding LEDs is not what it is made up to be)

My warranty was already off, since i purchased a refurbished off ebay. But when my old xbox had the e74, it was actually the internal hardware that overheated, because a thunder storm came through crashed my comp, xbox, and tv. All under surge protectors.

Microsoft asked once again for 100 bucks, got a used xbox for 40 bucks.
[/quote]You got a used xbox for 40 bucks? Link plz.

I want to get my girlfriend one but with no money or job, its hard :P[/quote]

Used xbox 360 for 40 bucks, no controllers, plugs or hard drive. just the xbox itself.

Use ebay and get a job -.-

Read full topic

However, you also void your warranty by opening it up to fix it.

I encountered an E74 error awhile back. Most idiots believe this is due to failure in the processing unit, however, my error was caused by a corrupt driver for that hardware. Just flashed my drive with firmware from a backup I made a month before and worked wonders.

As for this error, it doesn’t cost $100 if it is still under warranty, which mine was not (adding LEDs is not what it is made up to be)
[/quote]

My warranty was already off, since i purchased a refurbished off ebay. But when my old xbox had the e74, it was actually the internal hardware that overheated, because a thunder storm came through crashed my comp, xbox, and tv. All under surge protectors.

Microsoft asked once again for 100 bucks, got a used xbox for 40 bucks.[/quote]You got a used xbox for 40 bucks? Link plz.

I want to get my girlfriend one but with no money or job, its hard

Read full topic
